00012 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00013 // Finding valid device settings
00014 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00015 enum DXUT_MATCH_TYPE
00016 {
00017     DXUTMT_IGNORE_INPUT = 0,  // Use the closest valid value to a default 
00018     DXUTMT_PRESERVE_INPUT,    // Use input without change, but may cause no valid device to be found
00019     DXUTMT_CLOSEST_TO_INPUT   // Use the closest valid value to the input 
00020 };
00021 
00022 struct DXUTMatchOptions
00023 {
00024     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eAPIVersion;
00025     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eAdapterOrdinal;
00026     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eOutput;
00027     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eDeviceType;
00028     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eWindowed;
00029     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eAdapterFormat;
00030     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eVertexProcessing;
00031     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eResolution;
00032     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eBackBufferFormat;
00033     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eBackBufferCount;
00034     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eMultiSample;
00035     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eSwapEffect;
00036     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eDepthFormat;
00037     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eStencilFormat;
00038     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE ePresentFlags;
00039     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE eRefreshRate;
00040     DXUT_MATCH_TYPE ePresentInterval;
00041 };
00042 
00043 HRESULT WINAPI DXUTFindValidDeviceSettings( DXUTDeviceSettings* pOut, DXUTDeviceSettings* pIn = NULL,
00044                                             DXUTMatchOptions* pMatchOptions = NULL );

00077 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00078 // Enumerates available Direct3D9 adapters, devices, modes, etc.
00079 // Use DXUTGetD3D9Enumeration() to access global instance
00080 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00081 class CD3D9Enumeration
00082 {
00083 public:
00084     // These should be called before Enumerate(). 
00085     //
00086     // Use these calls and the IsDeviceAcceptable to control the contents of 
00087     // the enumeration object, which affects the device selection and the device settings dialog.
00088     void                    SetRequirePostPixelShaderBlending( bool bRequire )
00089     {
00090         m_bRequirePostPixelShaderBlending = bRequire;
00091     }
00092     void                    SetResolutionMinMax( UINT nMinWidth, UINT nMinHeight, UINT nMaxWidth, UINT nMaxHeight );
00093     void                    SetRefreshMinMax( UINT nMin, UINT nMax );
00094     void                    SetMultisampleQualityMax( UINT nMax );
00095     void                    GetPossibleVertexProcessingList( bool* pbSoftwareVP, bool* pbHardwareVP,
00096                                                              bool* pbPureHarewareVP, bool* pbMixedVP );
00097     void                    SetPossibleVertexProcessingList( bool bSoftwareVP, bool bHardwareVP, bool bPureHarewareVP,
00098                                                              bool bMixedVP );
00099     CGrowableArray <D3DFORMAT>* GetPossibleDepthStencilFormatList();
00100     CGrowableArray <D3DMULTISAMPLE_TYPE>* GetPossibleMultisampleTypeList();
00101     CGrowableArray <UINT>* GetPossiblePresentIntervalList();
00102     void                    ResetPossibleDepthStencilFormats();
00103     void                    ResetPossibleMultisampleTypeList();
00104     void                    ResetPossiblePresentIntervalList();
00105 
00106     // Call Enumerate() to enumerate available D3D adapters, devices, modes, etc.
00107     bool                    HasEnumerated()
00108     {
00109         return m_bHasEnumerated;
00110     }
00111     HRESULT                 Enumerate( LPDXUTCALLBACKISD3D9DEVICEACCEPTABLE IsD3D9DeviceAcceptableFunc = NULL,
00112                                        void* pIsD3D9DeviceAcceptableFuncUserContext = NULL );
00113 
00114     // These should be called after Enumerate() is called
00115     CGrowableArray <CD3D9EnumAdapterInfo*>* GetAdapterInfoList();
00116     CD3D9EnumAdapterInfo* GetAdapterInfo( UINT AdapterOrdinal );
00117     CD3D9EnumDeviceInfo* GetDeviceInfo( UINT AdapterOrdinal, D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType );
00118     CD3D9EnumDeviceSettingsCombo* GetDeviceSettingsCombo( DXUTD3D9DeviceSettings* pD3D9DeviceSettings )
00119     {
00120         return GetDeviceSettingsCombo( pD3D9DeviceSettings->AdapterOrdinal, pD3D9DeviceSettings->DeviceType,
00121                                        pD3D9DeviceSettings->AdapterFormat, pD3D9DeviceSettings->pp.BackBufferFormat,
00122                                        pD3D9DeviceSettings->pp.Windowed );
00123     }
00124     CD3D9EnumDeviceSettingsCombo* GetDeviceSettingsCombo( UINT AdapterOrdinal, D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType,
00125                                                           D3DFORMAT AdapterFormat, D3DFORMAT BackBufferFormat,
00126                                                           BOOL Windowed );
00127 
00128                             ~CD3D9Enumeration();
00129

00131     friend HRESULT WINAPI   DXUTCreateD3D9Enumeration();

00134                             CD3D9Enumeration();

00177 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00178 // A class describing an adapter which contains a unique adapter ordinal 
00179 // that is installed on the system
00180 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00181 class CD3D9EnumAdapterInfo
00182 {
00183 public:
00184             ~CD3D9EnumAdapterInfo();
00185 
00186     UINT AdapterOrdinal;
00187     D3DADAPTER_IDENTIFIER9 AdapterIdentifier;
00188     WCHAR   szUniqueDescription[256];
00189 
00190     CGrowableArray <D3DDISPLAYMODE> displayModeList; // Array of supported D3DDISPLAYMODEs
00191     CGrowableArray <CD3D9EnumDeviceInfo*> deviceInfoList; // Array of CD3D9EnumDeviceInfo* with unique supported DeviceTypes
00192 };

00195 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00196 // A class describing a Direct3D device that contains a 
00197 //       unique supported device type 
00198 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00199 class CD3D9EnumDeviceInfo
00200 {
00201 public:
00202     ~CD3D9EnumDeviceInfo();
00203 
00204     UINT AdapterOrdinal;
00205     D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType;
00206     D3DCAPS9 Caps;
00207 
00208     // List of CD3D9EnumDeviceSettingsCombo* with a unique set 
00209     // of AdapterFormat, BackBufferFormat, and Windowed
00210     CGrowableArray <CD3D9EnumDeviceSettingsCombo*> deviceSettingsComboList;
00211 };
00212 
00213 
00214 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00215 // A struct describing device settings that contains a unique combination of 
00216 // adapter format, back buffer format, and windowed that is compatible with a 
00217 // particular Direct3D device and the app.
00218 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00219 struct CD3D9EnumDeviceSettingsCombo
00220 {
00221     UINT AdapterOrdinal;
00222     D3DDEVTYPE DeviceType;
00223     D3DFORMAT AdapterFormat;
00224     D3DFORMAT BackBufferFormat;
00225     BOOL Windowed;
00226 
00227     CGrowableArray <D3DFORMAT> depthStencilFormatList; // List of D3DFORMATs
00228     CGrowableArray <D3DMULTISAMPLE_TYPE> multiSampleTypeList; // List of D3DMULTISAMPLE_TYPEs
00229     CGrowableArray <DWORD> multiSampleQualityList; // List of number of quality levels for each multisample type
00230     CGrowableArray <UINT> presentIntervalList; // List of D3DPRESENT flags
00231     CGrowableArray <CD3D9EnumDSMSConflict> DSMSConflictList; // List of CD3D9EnumDSMSConflict
00232 
00233     CD3D9EnumAdapterInfo* pAdapterInfo;
00234     CD3D9EnumDeviceInfo* pDeviceInfo;
00235 };
00236 
00237 
00238 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00239 // A depth/stencil buffer format that is incompatible with a
00240 // multisample type.
00241 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00242 struct CD3D9EnumDSMSConflict
00243 {
00244     D3DFORMAT DSFormat;
00245     D3DMULTISAMPLE_TYPE MSType;
00246 };

00396 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00397 // A struct describing device settings that contains a unique combination of 
00398 // adapter format, back buffer format, and windowed that is compatible with a 
00399 // particular Direct3D device and the app.
00400 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00401 struct CD3D10EnumDeviceSettingsCombo
00402 {
00403     UINT AdapterOrdinal;
00404     D3D10_DRIVER_TYPE DeviceType;
00405     DXGI_FORMAT BackBufferFormat;
00406     BOOL Windowed;
00407     UINT Output;
00408 
00409     CGrowableArray <UINT> multiSampleCountList; // List of valid sampling counts (multisampling)
00410     CGrowableArray <UINT> multiSampleQualityList; // List of number of quality levels for each multisample count
00411 
00412     CD3D10EnumAdapterInfo* pAdapterInfo;
00413     CD3D10EnumDeviceInfo* pDeviceInfo;
00414     CD3D10EnumOutputInfo* pOutputInfo;
00415 };
